title: Bridgewater Canal Way Walk Route

images.title: Sue Adair / Canal Basin on Bridgewater Canal, Runcorn
images.caption: Canal Basin on Bridgewater Canal, Runcorn

images.title: Dave Smethurst / Bridgewater Canal
images.caption: This is the view ESE from SJ715866 looking along the Bridgewater Canal. The picture was ataken from Agden Bridge.

images.title: Keith Williamson / Bridgewater Canal
images.caption: A view to the southeast from the East Lancashire Road. Beyond the canal, on the horizon, the buildings of Manchester city centre can just be made out. .

images.title: Keith Williamson / Bridgewater Canal
images.caption: A view to the northwest from the East Lancashire Road. The mill and chimneys in the distance are located in the town of Leigh.

images.title: Graham Horn / M6 crossing the Bridgewater Canal
images.caption: M6 crossing the Bridgewater Canal West of Lymm the M6 crosses the Bridgewater Canal. Because of nearby houses the wooden fence aims to minimise the noise from the motorway. If it all becomes too much, narrowboat Dolly is at the bottom of the garden for a quick and peaceful get-away.

description: A walk along the Bridgewater canal, through Cheshire, Greater Manchester and on into Lancashire. The route passes Salford , Trafford, Altrincham , Manchester, Warrington and Halton. Along the way you'll pass a series of nice parks including Dunham Massey , Worsley Woods and Sale Water Park. The path also forms part of the longer Cheshire Ring Canal Walk which follows six historic canals through Cheshire, Greater Manchester and Staffordshire. When complete the Bridgewater Way will also be open to cyclists.
